item.title: Thrilling finale in Antalya
item.description: The air was electric and fans were kept on the edge of their seats as the Antalya Grand Slam came to a close

item.title: Turkish opposition leads in vote to run Istanbul and other key cities, preliminary results showed
item.description: Turkish opposition leads in vote to run Istanbul and other key cities, preliminary results showed, in a major upset to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan who had set his sights on retaking control of those urban areas

item.title: Latest news bulletin | March 31st – Evening
item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Pope Francis calls for a ceasefire in Gaza during a blustery Easter Sunday Mass
item.description: Despite health concerns, the pontiff led the service in front of tens of thousands of people who had gathered in St Peter's Square in Vatican City.

item.title: Holy Easter Saturday celebrated across Europe
item.description: Pope Francis presides over the Vatican's Easter Vigil, as Germany's Easter peace marches call for end of war in Ukraine and Gaza.

item.title: Britain's King Charles attends Easter service, in first public appearance since cancer diagnosis
item.description: The Prince and Princess of Wales did not attend, as Catherine continues her cancer treatment.

item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: UN launches investigation into blast that injured three peacekeepers
item.description: Lebanese media claim that the UN peacekeepers were “subjected to an Israeli strike” carried out by drones., which Israel has denied.

item.title: Truce talks between Israel and Hamas resume in Cairo
item.description: All the latest developments from the Israel- Hamas war.

item.title: Romania and Bulgaria partly join Schengen area after thirteen-year-long wait
item.description: A veto from Austria means the new status will not apply for land routes, due to concerns of an influx of refugees.

item.title: The race is on for key cities as Turkey holds local elections
item.description: The vote is a barometer of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s popularity as he seeks to win back control of key urban areas he lost to the opposition five years ago

item.title: Does the European Union have the resources to match its ambitions?
item.description: Calls to reform the institutions to make the EU more efficient, more democratic and better adapted to contemporary challenges are growing.

item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: WATCH: Ambassadors lay flowers at site of Moscow concert hall massacre
item.description: WATCH: Foreign diplomats in Russia lay flowers at the site of last week’s attack on a suburban Moscow concert hall that killed 144 people.

item.title: WATCH: Catholics in Ecuador, Venezuela and Chile take part in Good Friday processions
item.description: Catholics in Ecuador took part in the Good Friday procession in central Quito, some of them wearing the traditional purple hoods known locally as "cucuruchos."

item.title: WATCH: Sand artists recreate the Passion of Christ in the Bolivian Andes
item.description: Artists from Bolivia and Argentina gathered in a desert area of the Bolivian Andes to recreate the Passion of Christ and images from the Old Testament of the Bible.

item.title: Foreign diplomats in Russia pay tribute to Crocus City Hall victims
item.description: The ambassadors laid flowers at the site of last week's attack on a Moscow concert hall where at least 144 people were killed by a group of gunmen

item.title: Ships leave Cyprus with second round of aid for Gaza
item.description: US charity, World Central Kitchen said that the supplies were enough to prepare more than one million meals.

item.title: Police arrest man as hostage situation ends in Dutch town of Ede
item.description: The reason for the hostage-taking was not clear, but police said on X that “at the moment there is no indication of a terrorist motive.”

item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Pope Francis skips Good Friday event to preserve health
item.description: Francis had been expected to preside over the Way of the Cross procession, but cancelled for the second year in a row over health concerns.

item.title: 9 detained in Tajikstan over Moscow concert hall shooting
item.description: The reported arrests come a week after the attack on concert hall outside of Moscow, where 144 people were killed.

item.title: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk warns war in Europe 'a real threat'
item.description: Tusk's stark warning comes as Ukraine and Russia trade strikes in Belgorod and Kamianske

item.title: Paris celebrates Easter with Olympic flair
item.description: Top chocolatier Nicolas Cloiseau has unveiled his Easter collection paying homage to the upcoming Olympic games.

item.title: Israel's Defence Minister says strikes will increase againt Hezbollah
item.description: Yoav Gallant's words come as the White House resumes talks to bring Israeli officials to Washington to discuss Rafah offensive.

item.title: Turkey Welcomes Judo To Antalya
item.description: Today marks the start of this highly anticipated Judo Grand Slam amidst this country's rich history, a nation renowned for its vibrant culture and scenic beauty.

item.title: Pope Francis leads Good Friday Mass in St. Peter's Basilica
item.description: The humble Easter ceremony evoked the pain of war, immigration and violence against women.

item.title: WATCH: Aftermath of deadly cyclone Gamane in Madagascar
item.description: The storm killed 18 people and left four missing after making landfall on the north of the Indian Ocean island nation earlier this week, authorities said on Friday.

item.title: Israel will return to the table for cease-fire talks with Hamas
item.description: Israel will return to the table for cease-fire talks with Hamas, says Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: Zelenskyy tells MEP delegation that EU solidarity is vital for morale
item.description: The Ukrainian prime minister made the comments to a group of MEPs from the liberal Renew Europe group, of which his own party is a member.

item.title: Russia barrages Ukraine with 99 drones and missiles
item.description: Kyiv claimed its air defences shot down 84 of them, whilst the energy minister said three power stations were hit.

item.title: Dogs understand when you talk to them - study
item.description: According to researchers in Hungary, dogs understand when they are spoken to and, like humans, are capable of associating a word with an object.

item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Surrounded by silence: The sole custodian of San Benedetto al Subasio Abbey
item.description: A sole custodian watches over the remote St Benedict's Abbey in Assisi.

item.title: Bus plunges off South Africa bridge, killing 45
item.description: An 8-year-old is the only survivor and is being treated for serious injuries.

item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: Top UN court orders Israel to allow more aid into Gaza
item.description: The Palestinian Foreign Ministry called the case “a vital step in the global effort to hold Israel accountable for perpetrating genocide.”

item.title: Italy raises security alert level for Easter weekend following Moscow attacks
item.description: The Italian government has expelled from the country around 50 people said to have links with terrorist organisations since October 7.

item.title: Prime Ministers of Poland and Ukraine make progress on easing farmer anger
item.description: The leaders said proposals were made on restricting Ukrainian food imports that farmers argue is undermining their livelihoods, but that more progress was necessary.

item.title: French budget deficit rose to 5.5% in 2023
item.description: The French budget deficit rose to 5.5% according to new data by statistical agency Insee. Prime Minister Attal announced welfare cuts could be imposed to lower the budget deficit to 2.7 percent by 2027.

item.title: Poland dismisses Eurocorps military commander
item.description: Lieutenant General Jarosław Gromadziński, who last year became the first Pole to lead Eurocorps, has been dismissed.

item.title: 'Nonsense': Putin rules out attacks on NATO countries
item.description: Putin has claimed Russia has no plans to attack NATO countries but will shoot down F-16 fighter jets sent to Ukraine from Western countries.

item.title: Middle East Forum Israel: 'Guterres wants Israel to lose, but he will fail'
item.description: Hamas understands that it can not win on the battlefield, so it tries to win in the court of global public opinion. Guterres, unfortunately, appears to be the poster boy for these efforts, Middle East Forum Israel’s Nave Dromi writes.

item.title: 'Disturbing': Rough sleepers and migrants removed from Paris ahead of Olympics
item.description: Hundreds of migrants and rough sleepers have been relocated from Paris to regional France on chartered bus services.

item.description: Catch up with the most important stories from around Europe and beyond - latest news, breaking news, World, Business, Entertainment, Politics, Culture, Travel.

item.title: 'Just miserable': War's toll on Palestinian children stuns doctors
item.description: Gut-wrenching child casualties from Israeli strikes were described to reporters by medics.
